Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ruminococcin C5 (RumCsp, RumC5, natural AMPs; lantibiotic, class 2a bacteriocin; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes, UCSS1b)

Literature Information.Literature: Five RumC genes were found and three pepties were detected. Two with MIC data. APD analysis reveals that the unmodified sequence of RumC5 shows 37% similarity toPa-AMP1.Activity: Active against C. perfringens CpA or S40, B. cereus TZ 415, and L. monocytogenes EGDE (imhibition halo size 1-3 mm).
Literature Information.Author: Crost EH, Ajandouz EH, Villard C, Geraert PA, Puigserver A, Fons M.2011
Literature Information.Title: Ruminococcin C, a new anti-Clostridium perfringens bacteriocin produced in the gut by the commensal bacterium Ruminococcus gnavus E1
